Content:
I was never happy about the modern fuel line on my 1949 bike.
So on cold, wet, British winters. What could be better than tinkering in the shed with traditional 1/4" copper pipe, old style brass taps, and silver solderd nut & nipples.
End result (according to a very good friend) "It looks like a wiskey still"! 🤣
What do other members think?... I could easily change it, by taking out the "Y" connector. Then use a brass "T" connector and a smaller coil.
